title: Four Michigan tribes get federal grant dollars for recycling projects - MLive.com
summary: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has awarded nearly $3.8 million to four Michigan tribes to upgrade their recycling and composting facilities, aiming to improve waste management and sustainability efforts. An additional $1.8 million was granted to the Michigan Recycling Coalition to educate the public about recycling practices. These funds are part of the agency's efforts to promote environmental protection and resource conservation.

title: Global Electronics Recycling Business Report 2023: Market to Reach $110.6 Billion by 2030 from $39.8 Billion in 2022 ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global electronics recycling market is expected to grow to $110.6 billion by 2030, driven by increasing smartphone adoption, the expanding IoT ecosystem, and rising concerns about environmental implications of plastic waste. The report highlights the importance of responsible recycling practices and resource recovery in a changing electronics landscape, with key players developing innovative solutions and collaborating to enhance sustainability.

title: Elfbar's pop-up event shines spotlight on responsible recycling for single-use vapes - Convenience Store
summary: Elf Bar, a vape brand, launched a GreenAwareness program to promote responsible recycling of single-use vapes. The program includes free recycling bins in stores and a conceptual single-use vape designed for easy disassembly and recycling. The initiative aims to address the growing problem of vape waste and demonstrate the recyclability of these products.
